Sentencas: The delamination of oxygen electrode during the electrolysis mode operation, which is mainly attributed to interfacial stress arising from the inability of oxygen electrode to accommodate oxygen species transported by oxide ion conducting electrolyte at the three phase boundary (TPB), has been major concern in the development of reversible solid oxide cell (RSOC) systems.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The use of lanthanum nickelate, La2NiO4+delta (LNO) as a RSOC oxygen electrode, because of its ability to accommodate excess oxygen species in interstitial positions, can be helpful in reliving such interfacial stresses and thus mitigating the problem of delamination.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: In this work, the possibility of using LNO as an oxygen electrode in RSOCs is examined.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The button cells with 10% gadolinium doped ceria (GDC10) electrolyte, Ni-GDC10 fuel electrode and LNO oxygen electrode are fabricated and their current-voltage-power (I-V-P) performance is analyzed in different gas conditions while operating in fuel cell mode in 500-650 degrees C range.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The button cell shows a maximum power density of similar to 0.19 W cm(-2) at a current density of similar to 0.5 A cm(-2) at 650 degrees C. Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy was performed in open circuit voltage (OCV) condition to analyze the various factors affecting the fuel cell performance.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The long term operation of the fuel cell at a fixed input current of 0.1 A cm(-2) for 100 h at 600 degrees C indicates that the fuel cell is capable of stable performance.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The microstructural analysis of the fuel cell after the long term operations indicates no structural degradation.
Titulo: La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells
La2NiO4+δ as oxygen electrode in reversible solid oxide cells
